channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Senate Prepares for Stimulus Vote
item.description: Now that the wage increase is out, a handful of moderate Democrats who were skeptical of it are more likely to support the bill. If it passes, the House will need to vote again on a matching version.  As soon as Wednesday, the Senate will vote.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: How Much Do You Know About Tax Forms? Take This 6-Question Quiz to Find Out
item.description: What is a Schedule SE (self-employment tax) form not used for: Net earnings on self employment Your benefits under social security The amount you owe in state taxes Answers: 1) a 2) c 3) e 4) false 5) b 6) c A Schedule F is a profit and loss form for: Finance Industry Professionals Farmers Fishermen Fathers Foundations 6. True or false: Only sole proprietors need to complete an individual income tax return.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: The Week Ahead: Stimulus Heads to Senate, February Jobs Report, and an Oil Decision
item.description: after which a new version will head back to the House, and ultimately to Biden’s desk for his signature. Looks great. Energy in focus: With oil prices surging, OPEC+ members will meet on Thursday to discuss whether to boost output accordingly.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 1
item.description: (Financial Times)  Read: Sapiens author Yuval Noah Harari on what we’ve learned from a year of Covid. The recent buying frenzy for song catalogs raises interesting questions of who should benefit, writes the WSJ.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Zoom Fatigue Is Real. Even Science Says So.
item.description: The constant stream of eyeball-straining, headache-inducing, don’t-get-caught-yawning Zoom calls are having a tangible effect on our brains, according to a new study from Stanford researchers.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: FDA Authorizes Johnson & Johnson Vaccine
item.description: J&J’s vaccine is only one dose and can be stored at normal refrigeration temperatures, so it’s ideal for use at drive-thru vaccination sites and with “transient population groups,” such as those on college campuses.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Warren Buffett Releases Annual Shareholder Letter and Berkshire Hathaway Earnings
item.description: That’s left Buffett with a huge cash pile he’s increasingly using for stock buybacks.  Let’s start with Berkshire Hathaway performance Berkshire is a conglomerate that wholly owns firms in industries such as insurance, railroads, and retail. Berkshire also bought back almost $25 billion of its own stock last year, reducing the total number of outstanding shares and increasing current investors’ ownership.  Looking ahead...  But notice what isn’t there: the pandemic, racial justice protests, the election, GameStop, and crypto. “There has been no incubator for unleashing human potential like America.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Warren Buffett Releases Annual Shareholder Letter and Berkshire Hathaway Earnings
item.description: That’s left Buffett with a huge cash pile he’s increasingly using for stock buybacks. Buffett steered clear of these supercharged topics, as he’s done for the majority of the last year.  Let’s start with Berkshire Hathaway performance Berkshire is a conglomerate that wholly owns firms in industries such as insurance, railroads, and retail. Berkshire also bought back almost $25 billion of its own stock last year, reducing the total number of outstanding shares and increasing current investors’ ownership. Looking ahead...  But notice what isn’t there: the pandemic, racial justice protests, the election, GameStop, and crypto.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: FDA Authorizes Johnson & Johnson Vaccine
item.description: J&J’s vaccine is only one dose and can be stored at normal refrigeration temperatures, so it’s ideal for use at drive-thru vaccination sites and with “transient population groups,” such as those on college campuses.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Science Says: Zoom Fatigue Is Real
item.description: The constant stream of eyeball-straining, headache-inducing, don’t-get-caught-yawning Zoom calls are having a tangible effect on our brains, according to a new study from Stanford researchers. Shares of the company are down around 16% in the last 10 days after exploding 443% in 2020.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Pokémon Keeps Evolving As It Turns 25
item.description: in the short-term, you can watch a Pokémon x Post Malone concert at 7pm ET and in the medium-term, see how Pokémon’s evolving again into an open-world RPG.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 27
item.description: (Bloomberg)  Read: A profile of Janelle Jones, the first Black woman to be chief Labor economist. We are in a serious inventory crunch, folks.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Netflix Starts a $100 Million Global Diversity Fund
item.description: Netflix is launching a global fund that will direct $100 million to initiatives supporting underrepresented groups in entertainment. Big picture: A new study by the University of Southern California’s Annenberg Inclusion Initiative found that underrepresented groups accounted for 36% of Netflix film leads in 2018 and 2019.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Covid Vaccine Tracker
item.description: Cleared for takeoff: Regulators in Canada approved AstraZeneca’s vaccine for adults, the third vaccine it’s approved. That’s up from 59.1 million doses last Saturday. Speaking of... In the US... Around the world…231 million doses have been administered in 100 different countries, up from 193 million doses in 87 countries last week.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: White House Ups the Pressure on MBS in New Report
item.description: Saudi Arabia is also the largest buyer of US defense goods.  The backstoryKhashoggi, a Washington Post columnist and critic of the Saudi royal family, was assassinated in 2018 in the Saudi consulate in Istanbul. Following Khashoggi’s murder in 2018, corporate America tried to distance itself from the kingdom by skipping the buzzy “Davos in the Desert” investment conference held in the Saudi capital, Riyadh. Khashoggi’s killing drew outrage from the international media and US lawmakers, and investigations zeroed in on the role of Mohammed bin Salman (MBS), the 35-year-old de facto ruler of the kingdom.
item.author: Neal Freyman

Following Khashoggi’s murder in 2018, corporate America tried to distance itself from the kingdom by skipping the buzzy “Davos in the Desert” investment conference held in the Saudi capital, Riyadh.     Looking ahead...

item.title: Covid Vaccine Tracker
item.description: Cleared for takeoff: Regulators in Canada approved AstraZeneca’s vaccine for adults, the third vaccine it’s approved. 1.45 million doses per day were administered last week, on average, a slight dip from the 1.58 million average a week prior. That’s up from 59.1 million doses last Saturday. Speaking of... In the US...
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Brew Crossword: Success Stories
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Why Does Every Streaming Service Have a Plus Sign?
item.description: Some industry analysts think that streaming services may be in a better position for the long-term if they can resist adding the plus sign.  Off the top of my head I can count Discovery+, Disney+, ESPN+, Apple TV+, BET+, and AMC+. we may not have another streaming service with a + for a while, because we may not even have a new streaming service for a while.  "Our research confirmed that the plus sign has become synonymous with streaming video on demand services," David Leavy, chief operating officer for Discovery, told the LA Times. As CNBC notes, Paramount+ is the last of the big streaming unveils that started with Apple TV+ in March 2019.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Soho House Files to Go Public: Will the Travel Industry Bounce Back?
item.description: The IPO is kinda like Soho House itself—we all poke fun at its upper-crust, jet-set brand, right up until we're two Sancerres deep and considering a mortgage refinance to cover a membership.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 26
item.description: (Protocol) com built a streaming empire.  Read: How Chess.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Costco Raises Minimum Wage to $16
item.description: Yesterday, Costco CEO Craig Jelinek said his company is bumping starting pay to $16/hour—$1 more than Target, Best Buy, and Amazon.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Markets at a Crossroads: Stocks Drop and Bonds Surge
item.description: Yesterday, the yield on the 10-year note briefly surpassed what's known as the S&P's "dividend yield," a threshold investors use to measure the relative attractiveness of stocks vs. The more a bond yields, the more it competes with stocks. Some perspective before we move on: The Dow hit a record high on Wednesday, and the S&P is less than 3% below its all-time high.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Brew’s Weekly News Quiz: February 26
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Costco Raises Minimum Wage to $16
item.description: wage in 2018, recently embarked on a PR blitz for a $15 federal minimum wage. Raising pay has helped the company recruit and pressure competitors, particularly Walmart, which just last week upped wages for 425,000 employees.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: How to File Your Taxes as an LLC
item.description: Plus, maybe an E (real estate, royalties, and other stuff), or an F (farmers, what’s up).  Now, there are a couple ways to file as an LLC: If you’re a single-member LLC (you own the business, and only you) and you’re filing as an individual, you’ll report your income and expenses on a 1040 (individual income tax return) and a Schedule C (profit or loss from an unincorporated business).  If you have employees, you’ll file separately from a 1040 or 1065: Estimated Tax: 1040-ESSocial Security, Medicare, and Income Tax Withholding: 941, 943, 944 More Info on Social Security, Medicare, and Income Tax Withholding: W-2, W-3 Federal Unemployment (FUTA) Tax: 940 You may also need to work through issues like information returns (payments to and transactions with non-employees) and excise taxes (taxes paid on certain goods, like gas). Or you simply like to decompress with a weighted blanket and some tax documents?
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: Silicon Valley Mainstay Fry’s Electronics Store to Close
item.description: Fry’s was unable to pivot to e-commerce quickly enough to compete with rivals like Amazon and Best Buy. Then, the Covid-19 pandemic delivered the fatal blow, causing foot traffic to plummet and in-store experiences to become irrelevant.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 25
item.description: Quote: “This is not ideal for us and it’s not a new normal. Read: The secret message NASA sent to Mars, and the people who decoded it. Texas’s move to deregulate power generation is being blamed for last week’s electricity crisis.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: First Covax Delivery Touches Down in Accra, Ghana
item.description: Funded by donations, it hopes to vaccinate 20% of people in the world’s 92 poorest countries by the end of the year. Yesterday, Ghana became the first country to receive a vaccine care package from the UN-backed Covax program. Ivory Coast is up next later this week.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Biden Addresses Global Semiconductor Chip Shortage With Executive Order
item.description: Bottom line: While just a starting point, Biden’s executive order hopes to eventually reduce the US’ reliance on other countries across a wide swath of critical industries. Though the trip was a success, it exposed just how fragile the US public health supply chain is.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: The First Fully Digital, NFT Artwork Is Headed to Auction
item.description: Now, NFT couldn’t ask for a more legitimizing momentWhile NFTs can arguably be traced back to 2012, they didn’t hit the mainstream until 2017 with blockchain-based CryptoKitties.  On the auction block: A digital collage of the first 5,000 other-worldy images from Beeple’s “everyday” series, in which Winkelmann has created a new piece of digital art every day for over 10 years. Last December, a collection of 20 Beeple pieces sold for $3.5 million on another NFT platform, Nifty Gateway. Check out our NFT FAQ here.
item.author: Jamie Wilde
